org.xflatdb.xflat.query

Class XPathQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xflatdb.xflat.query.XPathQuery

  • public class XPathQuery
extends Object
    Represents a query in the XPath Query Language.

    Queries are constructed using XPath expressions associated to values. The XPath expressions select elements or attributes in the row data which are convertible to the query's value type, and then the converted value type is compared to the given value to see if the row matches the query.

    The row is matched to the query if any one of the nodes selected by the XPath expression match the query. This means that an Equals query which selects the individual item elements of a list will match if any item in the list matches the query.

    Author:
    Gordon

    • Field Detail

      • Id

        public static final org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression<org.jdom2.Attribute> Id
        An XPath expression selecting the database ID of a row. This can be used to build queries matching the row's ID.

        Currently this is the expression "@db:id".

    • Method Detail

      • getSelector

        public org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression<?> getSelector()
        Gets the XPath expression that is the selector for this query. AND and OR queries have null here, their subqueries have this populated.
        Returns:
        the selecting expression for this query.

      • getRowMatcher

        public org.hamcrest.Matcher<org.jdom2.Element> getRowMatcher()
        Gets the Hamcrest matcher that matches database rows. This is used to determine if a row is a match for a query.
        Returns:
        The database row hamcrest matcher.

      • getValue

        public Object getValue()
        Gets the value to which the element selected by the selector should be compared, according to this query's type.
        AND and OR queries have null here, their subqueries have this populated.
        Returns:
        the value that will be compared to the selected element.

      • getValueType

        public Class<?> getValueType()
        Gets the type of the value, to which the selected element should be convertible so it can be compared to the value.
        Returns:
        The type of the value, or null if the value is null.

      • getQueryType

        public XPathQuery.QueryType getQueryType()
        Gets the type of this query, ie. EQ, NE, AND, OR, etc.
        Returns:
        The type of query.

      • getSubQueries

        public List<XPathQuery> getSubQueries()
        Gets the sub queries of this query. This is only populated for AND and OR queries.
        Returns:
        A list of all the sub queries, or an empty list if this is not an AND or OR query.

      • setConversionService

        public void setConversionService(ConversionService service)
        Sets the conversion service for the entire query chain. Necessary for matchers that match against non-JDOM types.

        JDOM Engines will set this automatically when they execute the query.

        Parameters:
        service - The conversion service to use to convert selected data to the comparable value type.

      • setAlternateIdExpression

        public void setAlternateIdExpression(org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression<Object> expression)
        Sets an expression that represents the DOM node where the object's ID is stored. Some engines can make use of queries on ID for indexing, so they need to know the alternate ID expression in case the user queries on that rather than Id.

        This is automatically populated by ConvertingTable.

        Parameters:
        expression - The expression which represents an alternate way to select the ID.

      • dissectId

        public <U> IntervalSet<U> dissectId(Comparator<U> comparer,
                           Class<U> idClass)
        A special overload of dissect that is based on an ID index. Takes advantage of an alternate ID expression if it exists.
        Type Parameters:
        U -
        Parameters:
        comparer - A comparer comparing instances of idClass.
        idClass - The class to which the ID is convertible.
        Returns:
        An IntervalSet representing the values on the index to search.
        Throws:
        InvalidQueryException - if the query expects the ID to be of a different class.

      • dissect

        public <U> IntervalSet<U> dissect(org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression index,
                         Comparator<U> comparer,
                         Class<U> indexClass)
        Dissects the query based on the given index. This returns the Intervals on the index to which this query should be applied. If the query is invalid for the index applied, an InvalidQueryException is thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        U -
        Parameters:
        index - The XPathExpression describing an index on a table.
        comparer - A Comparator for the expected values of the index.
        indexClass - The class to which the value selected by the index is expected to be convertible.
        Returns:
        An IntervalSet representing the values on the index to search.
        Throws:
        InvalidQueryException - if the query is not valid for the given index and index class.

      • dissect

        public <U> IntervalSet<U> dissect(org.hamcrest.Matcher<org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression> index,
                         Comparator<U> comparer,
                         Class<U> indexClass)
        Dissects the query based on the given index. This returns the Intervals on the index to which this query should be applied. If the query is invalid for the index applied, an InvalidQueryException is thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        U -
        Parameters:
        index - A matcher matching an XPathExpression describing an index on a table.
        comparer - A Comparator for the expected values of the index.
        indexClass - The class to which the value selected by the index is expected to be convertible.
        Returns:
        An IntervalSet representing the values on the index to search.
        Throws:
        InvalidQueryException - if the query is not valid for the given index and index class.

        Type Parameters:
        U - the type of the value
        Parameters:

        object - The object that the result of the xpath selection should be equal to.
        Returns:

      • and

        public static XPathQuery and(XPathQuery... queries)
        Create an XPath query that matches when all of the provided queries match.
        Parameters:
        queries - The queries that all must match.
        Returns:
        an XpathQuery object

      • or

        public static XPathQuery or(XPathQuery... queries)
        Create an XpathQuery that matches when any of the provided queries match.
        Parameters:
        queries - the queries, one of which must match.
        Returns:
        an XpathQuery object.

      • matches

        public static <U> XPathQuery matches(org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression<?> selector,
                     org.hamcrest.Matcher<U> matcher,
                     Class<U> clazz)
        Create an XpathQuery that matches when the given matcher matches the value selected by the Xpath selector.
        Type Parameters:
        U - The type of the value expected at the end of the selector.
        Parameters:
        selector - The Xpath expression that selects a value in a row.
        matcher - The matcher that decides whether this row is a match.
        clazz - The type of the value expected at the end of the selector.
        Returns:
        an XpathQuery object.

      • exists

        public static XPathQuery exists(org.jdom2.xpath.XPathExpression<?> selector)
        functions the same as ne(selector, null), but does not invoke the conversion service.
        Parameters:
        selector - The selector to test whether it exists.
        Returns:
        An XpathQuery object.

      • any

        public static XPathQuery any()
        An XPathQuery that matches any and all rows regardless of content. useful for find all or delete all.
        Returns:
        A new XPathQuery that will match all rows.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the string representation of this query.
